description: Runs Jupyter Kernels in the Erdos Jupyter Kernel Supervisor
configuration.logLevel.description:
Log level for the kernel supervisor.

Applies to Erdos Desktop only; restart Erdos to apply.
configuration.shutdownTimeout.descriptio:
When should kernels be shut down after Erdos is closed?

Timeouts are in hours and start once the kernel is idle.

Applies to Erdos Desktop only; restart Erdos to apply.
configuration.shutdownTimeout.immediatel: Shut down kernels immediately when Erdos is closed
configuration.shutdownTimeout.whenIdle.d: Wait for kernels to finish any running computations, then shut them down
configuration.showTerminal.description: Show the host terminal for the Erdos kernel supervisor
configuration.connectionTimeout.descript: Timeout in seconds for connecting to the kernel's sockets
configuration.attachOnStartup.descriptio: Run <f5> before starting up Jupyter kernel (when supported)
configuration.sleepOnStartup.description: Sleep for n seconds before starting up Jupyter kernel (when supported)
configuration.runInShell.description: Run kernels in a login shell (on Unix-like systems)
configuration.maxBufferSizeMB.descriptio: Maximum size in megabytes for binary buffers passed between IPyWidgets and the kernel
configuration.transport.description:
Transport mechanism for the connection between Erdos and the supervisor.

Applies to Erdos Desktop only; restart Erdos to apply.
configuration.transport.ipc.description: Use native IPC (named pipes on Windows, Unix sockets on other platforms)
configuration.transport.ipc.label: Native IPC
configuration.transport.tcp.label: Local TCP
command.showKernelSupervisorLog.title: Show the Kernel Supervisor Log
command.reconnectSession.title: Reconnect the Current Session
command.restartSupervisor.title: Restart the Kernel Supervisor
